summary: Gale Lynn Oppenberg was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents indicate her employment spanned from at least December 1977 to November 1978. She is mentioned in several payroll-related documents, including certification reports and payroll authorization forms. These documents detail her position, annual salary, and pay period earnings during her time with the HSCA. The documents suggest her role was likely administrative or supportive, as she is listed among other HSCA staff in payroll records.
significance: Gale Lynn Oppenberg's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with reinvestigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. While the specific nature of her work is not detailed, her presence on the HSCA payroll indicates she contributed to the committee's operations, even if in a supporting role.
